full_sentence: 'No. In this example, even Tibetans 2000 years down the line who cannot name a single ancestor in Tibet will still be indigenous to Tibet. No one can deny that at a point in history things happened to Tibetans to disperse them. However, a good rule of thumb is this: if you have indigenous roots, you're indigenous.'
